content:
Ehh tie CLC importi :rolling_eyes: clc-importi.png

Vai ir kāda jēga no tiem CLC_Novads= tegiem? Tik un tā reāli viņi visi ir ļoti aptuveni. Un vai pat jēga no source=CLC_2006? Es, ja laboju, tos dzēšu tik un tā, jo nav vairs pareizs source, ja es ortofoto izmantoju.
Nē, bet dažus metrus garam ar CLC tegiem apzīmētam wayam, kas veido meža multipoligonu

Skaidrs, paldies. Jā vērtīgs multipoligona ceļš :)
Tagus arī cenšos atcerēties noņemt, ja laboju.
Tāpat nost neņemu, lai uzreiz redzams, kāpēc šķībs mežs.
What does CLC mean here? I just noticed this tag when looking through undocumented tags for Lithuania (because geographic boundaries aren't fully respected in Taginfo I guess)

DodoGTA said:

What does CLC mean here? I just noticed this tag when looking through undocumented tags for Lithuania (because geographic boundaries aren't fully respected in Taginfo I guess)

I only know it means corine land cover, like a forest import for countries in europe

Yes, CLC stands for "CORINE Land Cover" and was added when forests were being imported. The tag is a bit misused, it should have been in source. But also, it shouldn't be added to begin with because it's the changeset that defines the source. Almost every single forest has been edited since, so these values are out of date - the forest no longer matches CLC data. I personally remove these whenever I modify the geometry. At some point we should just agree to finally remove them all in bulk.
